greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of triangles with sides whose squares are integers and with positive integer area and longest side of length sqrt(n).
example: a(13)=3 since the 3 triangles with sides {sqrt(13), sqrt(5), sqrt(4)}, {sqrt(13), sqrt(8), sqrt(1)} and {sqrt(13), sqrt(9), sqrt(4)} have areas 2, 1 and 3 respectively.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 07 2002
